messages.content: List all statefulsets in the 'default' namespace
kubectl get statefulsets -n default
List all daemonsets across the cluster
kubectl get daemonsets --all-namespaces
Describe the daemonset named 'log-agent' in namespace 'logging'
kubectl describe daemonset log-agent -n logging
Create a namespace called 'monitoring'
kubectl create namespace monitoring
Set a resource quota named 'compute-quota' in namespace 'dev' limiting pods to 10
kubectl create quota compute-quota --hard=pods=10 -n dev
Delete the resource quota 'compute-quota' from namespace 'dev'
kubectl delete quota compute-quota -n dev
List all resource quotas in the current namespace
kubectl get quota
List all roles in the 'default' namespace
kubectl get roles -n default
List all rolebindings in the 'default' namespace
kubectl get rolebindings -n default
Create a role named 'pod-reader' with permissions to get, list, and watch pods in the 'default' namespace
kubectl create role pod-reader --verb=get,list,watch --resource=pods -n default
Delete the rolebinding 'read-pods' from the 'default' namespace
kubectl delete rolebinding read-pods -n default
List all available API versions in the cluster
kubectl api-versions
Retrieve the external IP of the service 'ingress-nginx' in the 'ingress-nginx' namespace
kubectl get svc ingress-nginx -n ingress-nginx
Run a one-time busybox job interactively and remove it after completion
kubectl run busybox --image=busybox --rm -it -- /bin/sh
Copy a file from pod 'app-pod' in namespace 'default' to the local machine
kubectl cp default/app-pod:/path/to/remote/file ./local-file
Copy a file from the local machine to pod 'app-pod' in namespace 'default'
kubectl cp ./local-file default/app-pod:/path/to/remote/file
Execute an interactive shell inside pod 'app-pod' in the 'default' namespace
kubectl exec -it app-pod -- /bin/
Create a secret named 'file-secret' from a file 'secrettxt'
kubectl create secret generic file-secret --from-file=secret.txt
Update secret 'file-secret' with a new file 'new-secrettxt' using a dry run and apply
kubectl create secret generic file-secret --from-file=new-secret.txt --dry-run=client -o yaml | kubectl apply -f -
List all persistent volumes in the cluster
kubectl get pv
List all persistent volume claims in the 'default' namespace
kubectl get pvc -n default
Delete the persistent volume claim named 'data-pvc' in the 'default' namespace
kubectl delete pvc data-pvc -n default
Describe the persistent volume 'pv-volume1'
kubectl describe pv pv-volume1
Show all node labels in the cluster
kubectl get nodes --show-labels
Patch service 'web-service' to change its type to NodePort using a JSON merge patch
kubectl patch service web-service -p '{"spec":{"type":"NodePort"}}'
Convert the YAML file 'fileyaml' to JSON format using kubectl
kubectl convert -f file.yaml --output-version v1
Create a configmap named 'my-config' from literal key-value pairs
kubectl create configmap my-config --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2=value2
Replace the resource defined in 'new-configyaml'
kubectl replace -f new-config.yaml
Edit the configmap 'app-config' interactively
kubectl edit configmap app-config
Display resource usage for pods in the 'kube-system' namespace
kubectl top pod -n kube-system
Show the rollout status of the daemonset 'node-exporter' in the 'monitoring' namespace
kubectl rollout status daemonset node-exporter -n monitoring
Force restart pod 'cache-pod' in the 'default' namespace by deleting it
kubectl delete pod cache-pod -n default
Annotate pod 'frontend-pod' with a backup timestamp
kubectl annotate pod frontend-pod backup='2025-02-04T12:00:00Z'
Label deployment 'backend-deployment' with version 'v12'
kubectl label deployment backend-deployment version=v1.2
Remove the 'version' label from service 'api-service'
kubectl label service api-service version-
Create a job named 'backup-job' using the YAML configuration in 'backup-jobyaml'
kubectl create -f backup-job.yaml
Suspend the cronjob 'daily-backup' by setting its suspend flag to true
kubectl patch cronjob daily-backup -p '{"spec": {"suspend": true}}'
Resume the cronjob 'daily-backup' by setting its suspend flag to false
kubectl patch cronjob daily-backup -p '{"spec": {"suspend": false}}'
List all cronjobs in the 'backup' namespace
kubectl get cronjobs -n backup
Delete the cronjob 'old-backup' from the 'backup' namespace
kubectl delete cronjob old-backup -n backup
Create a cronjob named 'log-cleanup' from the file 'log-cleanup-cronjobyaml'
kubectl create -f log-cleanup-cronjob.yaml
Describe the cronjob 'db-backup' in the current namespace
kubectl describe cronjob db-backup
List all endpoints in the 'default' namespace
kubectl get endpoints -n default
Display detailed resource usage for the pod 'api-pod' in the 'default' namespace
kubectl top pod api-pod -n default
List all custom resource definitions in the cluster
kubectl get crds
Describe the custom resource definition 'myresourcesexamplecom'
kubectl describe crd myresources.example.com
View the previous logs of pod 'web-pod' in case of a restart
kubectl logs web-pod --previous
Fetch events related to the pod 'api-pod'
kubectl get events --field-selector involvedObject.name=api-pod
Apply a network policy defined in 'network-policyyaml'
kubectl apply -f network-policy.yaml
Delete the network policy 'deny-all' in the 'default' namespace
kubectl delete networkpolicy deny-all -n default
List all network policies in the 'prod' namespace
kubectl get networkpolicies -n prod
Annotate node 'node-3' with a maintenance window set to '2025-02-05'
kubectl annotate node node-3 maintenance='2025-02-05'
Set a taint on node 'node-4' with key 'key', value 'value', and effect 'NoSchedule'
kubectl taint node node-4 key=value:NoSchedule
Remove the taint 'key:NoSchedule' from node 'node-4'
kubectl taint node node-4 key:NoSchedule-
List all validating webhook configurations
kubectl get validatingwebhookconfigurations
List all mutating webhook configurations
kubectl get mutatingwebhookconfigurations
Describe the mutating webhook configuration 'example-mutator'
kubectl describe mutatingwebhookconfiguration example-mutator
Label the namespace 'dev' with team 'development'
kubectl label namespace dev team=development
Annotate the namespace 'prod' with owner 'ops-team'
kubectl annotate namespace prod owner=ops-team
Export the configuration of deployment 'app' to JSON
kubectl get deployment app -o json
Export the configuration of service 'my-service' to JSON
kubectl get service my-service -o json
List all secrets across all namespaces
kubectl get secrets --all-namespaces
Describe the secret 'tls-secret' in the 'default' namespace
kubectl describe secret tls-secret -n default
Create a TLS secret named 'tls-secret' using certificate and key files
kubectl create secret tls tls-secret --cert=cert.crt --key=cert.key
Update the image of statefulset 'mongo' to 'mongo:42'
kubectl set image statefulset/mongo mongo=mongo:4.2
Edit the daemonset 'fluentd' in the 'logging' namespace
kubectl edit daemonset fluentd -n logging
Display the rollout status for statefulset 'redis'
kubectl rollout status statefulset redis
Annotate statefulset 'redis' with a last-updated timestamp
kubectl annotate statefulset redis last-updated='2025-02-04T12:00:00Z'
List all jobs in the 'batch' namespace
kubectl get jobs -n batch
Describe the job 'data-processing' in the 'batch' namespace
kubectl describe job data-processing -n batch
Run a pod using the busybox image with no restart policy for a one-off task
kubectl run temp --image=alpine --restart=Never --command -- sleep 3600
Delete the pod named 'temp' from the 'default' namespace
kubectl delete pod temp -n default
Set the environment variable 'ENV=production' on deployment 'webapp'
kubectl set env deployment/webapp ENV=production
Unset the environment variable 'DEBUG' on deployment 'webapp'
kubectl set env deployment/webapp DEBUG-
Execute a command in one of the pods labeled 'app=worker' interactively
kubectl exec -it $(kubectl get pods -l app=worker -o jsonpath='{.items[0].metadata.name}') -- /bin/sh
Port-forward the service 'my-service' so that local port 8080 maps to port 80 on the service
kubectl port-forward service/my-service 8080:80
Expose the pod 'solo-pod' on port 9090
kubectl expose pod solo-pod --port=9090
Scale the deployment 'scalable-app' to 10 replicas
kubectl scale deployment scalable-app --replicas=10
Update resource limits for deployment 'resource-app' using a patch
kubectl patch deployment resource-app -p '{"spec":{"template":{"spec":{"containers":[{"name":"resource-app","resources":{"limits":{"cpu":"250m","memory":"512Mi"}}}]}}}}'
Create a Horizontal Pod Autoscaler for deployment 'webapp' with min 2, max 10 replicas and target CPU utilization of 80%
kubectl autoscale deployment webapp --min=2 --max=10 --cpu-percent=80
Retrieve the status of the Horizontal Pod Autoscaler for 'webapp'
kubectl get hpa webapp
Delete the Horizontal Pod Autoscaler for 'webapp'
kubectl delete hpa webapp
Create a Pod Disruption Budget from the configuration in 'pdbyaml'
kubectl create -f pdb.yaml
List all Pod Disruption Budgets in the 'default' namespace
kubectl get pdb -n default
Delete the Pod Disruption Budget named 'app-pdb' from the 'default' namespace
kubectl delete pdb app-pdb -n default
Annotate deployment 'stateless-app' with 'team=backend'
kubectl annotate deployment stateless-app team=backend
List all deployments with the label 'tier=backend'
kubectl get deployments -l tier=backend
Run a privileged pod using the busybox image that stays running
kubectl run privileged --image=busybox --privileged --restart=Never -- /bin/sh -c 'while true; do sleep 30; done;'
Fetch logs for the container named 'sidecar' in the pod 'multi-container-pod'
kubectl logs multi-container-pod -c sidecar
Stream logs for the container 'main' in the pod 'multi-container-pod'
kubectl logs multi-container-pod -c main -f
Expose the deployment 'webapp' as a LoadBalancer service on port 80
kubectl expose deployment webapp --type=LoadBalancer --port=80
Delete the service 'old-service' from the 'default' namespace
kubectl delete svc old-service -n default
List all namespaces in the cluster
kubectl get namespaces
Describe the namespace 'default'
kubectl describe namespace default
Export the configuration of all pods in the 'kube-system' namespace to a JSON file named 'podsjson'
kubectl get pods -n kube-system -o json > pods.json
Display resource usage for pods in the 'production' namespace
kubectl top pods -n production
Retrieve events for the 'monitoring' namespace
kubectl get events -n monitoring
Convert the JSON configuration file 'configjson' to a Kubernetes YAML manifest
kubectl convert -f config.json -o yaml
List all pods in all namespaces
kubectl get pods --all-namespaces
Get details of the pod named 'webserver'
kubectl describe pod webserver
Delete the service 'backend-service'
kubectl delete service backend-service
Scale the deployment 'frontend' to 5 replicas
kubectl scale deployment frontend --replicas=5
Show nodes in the cluster
kubectl get nodes
Create a namespace called 'staging'
kubectl create namespace staging
Get logs of the pod 'database-pod'
kubectl logs database-pod
Expose deployment 'myapp' on port 8080
kubectl expose deployment myapp --port=8080
Apply the configuration in 'configyaml'
kubectl apply -f config.yaml
Delete namespace 'test-environment'
kubectl delete namespace test-environment
Get events for the 'default' namespace
kubectl get events -n default
Describe the service 'web-service'
kubectl describe service web-service
Update the image of deployment 'api' to 'api:v2'
kubectl set image deployment/api api=api:v2
Get the current context
kubectl config current-context
Set the context to 'production'
kubectl config use-context production
Get resource usage of nodes
kubectl top nodes
Explain the 'deployment' resource
kubectl explain deployment
Get all services in the 'dev' namespace
kubectl get services -n dev
Run a pod with image 'nginx' named 'nginx-test'
kubectl run nginx-test --image=nginx
Edit the deployment 'frontend'
kubectl edit deployment frontend
Cordon the node 'node-1'
kubectl cordon node-1
Drain the node 'node-2'
kubectl drain node-2
Uncordon the node 'node-1'
kubectl uncordon node-1
Delete pod 'temp-pod' in namespace 'test'
kubectl delete pod temp-pod -n test
List configmaps in all namespaces
kubectl get configmaps --all-namespaces
Get the secret 'db-secret' in namespace 'prod'
kubectl get secret db-secret -n prod
Describe ingress 'my-ingress'
kubectl describe ingress my-ingress
Get the status of deployment 'backend'
kubectl rollout status deployment backend
Restart deployment 'cache'
kubectl rollout restart deployment cache
View the history of rollout for deployment 'webapp'
kubectl rollout history deployment webapp
Create a service account named 'deploy' in 'staging' namespace
kubectl create serviceaccount deploy -n staging
Attach to the pod 'debug-pod'
kubectl attach debug-pod
Get all resources in namespace 'production'
kubectl get all -n production
Port-forward pod 'my-pod' port 8080 to local port 8080
kubectl port-forward pod/my-pod 8080:8080
Scale statefulset 'mysql' to 3 replicas
kubectl scale statefulset mysql --replicas=3
Patch deployment 'api' with 'patchyaml'
kubectl patch deployment api --patch-file=patch.yaml
Delete all pods with label 'app=test'
kubectl delete pods -l app=test
Get pod IP addresses in 'default' namespace
kubectl get pods -n default -o wide
Explain the 'service' resource
kubectl explain service
Apply all YAML files in 'manifests' directory
kubectl apply -f manifests/
Get the cluster version information
kubectl version
Create a deployment named 'redis' with image 'redis:60'
kubectl create deployment redis --image=redis:6.0
Describe node 'worker-node-1'
kubectl describe node worker-node-1
Get events sorted by timestamp
kubectl get events --sort-by=.metadata.creationTimestamp
Delete job 'batch-job'
kubectl delete job batch-job
Create configmap 'app-config' from file 'configproperties'
kubectl create configmap app-config --from-file=config.properties
Explain 'persistentvolumeclaim'
kubectl explain persistentvolumeclaim
Get services with label 'tier=frontend'
kubectl get services -l tier=frontend
Delete all pods in 'development' namespace
kubectl delete pods --all -n development
Get the logs of pod 'app-pod' since 1 hour ago
kubectl logs app-pod --since=1h
Get pod 'db-pod' logs and follow
kubectl logs db-pod -f
Get cluster info
kubectl cluster-info
Show me the cluster details
kubectl cluster-info
Get the Kubernetes version
kubectl version
List all nodes in the cluster
kubectl get nodes
Check the status of cluster components
kubectl get componentstatuses
Describe the cluster
kubectl cluster-info dump
Get cluster info
kubectl cluster-info
Get API resources
kubectl api-resources
List all services with type ClusterIP in namespace 'dev'
kubectl get svc -n dev --field-selector spec.type=ClusterIP
Get detailed information of ingress 'app-ingress' in namespace 'prod'
kubectl describe ingress app-ingress -n prod
Restart pod 'frontend-pod' by deleting it to force a new instance in the 'default' namespace
kubectl delete pod frontend-pod -n default
Show rollout status for statefulset 'zookeeper'
kubectl rollout status statefulset zookeeper
Display endpoints for service 'backend-svc' in namespace 'prod'
kubectl get endpoints backend-svc -n prod
List all pods with label app=api in the 'staging' namespace
kubectl get pods -n staging -l app=api
View detailed information of the replication controller 'old-rc'
kubectl describe rc old-rc
Create a replication controller using the configuration file 'rcyaml'
kubectl create -f rc.yaml
Delete the replication controller 'old-rc'
kubectl delete rc old-rc
Update the image of replication controller 'rc-example' to 'nginx:119'
kubectl set image rc/rc-example nginx=nginx:1.19
Show all pods in the 'staging' namespace using wide output
kubectl get pods -n staging -o wide
Stream logs from all containers in pod 'multi-pod'
kubectl logs multi-pod --all-containers=true -f
Show secrets in the 'kube-system' namespace in a table format
kubectl get secrets -n kube-system
List all storage classes available in the cluster
kubectl get storageclasses
Describe the storage class 'standard'
kubectl describe storageclass standard
Create a persistent volume claim using the file 'pvcyaml'
kubectl create -f pvc.yaml
Replace the persistent volume claim using the configuration in 'pvc-newyaml'
kubectl replace -f pvc-new.yaml
Annotate the persistent volume claim 'data-pvc' with a retention policy of 30 days
kubectl annotate pvc data-pvc retention=30d
Label all pods in the 'test' namespace with the label environment=test
kubectl label pods --all environment=test -n test
Remove the 'environment' label from all pods in the 'test' namespace
kubectl label pods --all environment- -n test
Scale the replication controller 'rc-example' to 5 replicas
kubectl scale rc rc-example --replicas=5
Get the resource version of deployment 'app-deploy'
kubectl get deployment app-deploy -o=jsonpath='{.metadata.resourceVersion}'
Display only the names of pods in the 'default' namespace
kubectl get pods -n default -o custom-columns=NAME:.metadata.name
List nodes with custom columns showing name and ready status
kubectl get nodes -o custom-columns=NAME:.metadata.name,READY:.status.conditions[?(@.type=="Ready")].status
Retrieve the last 100 lines of logs from kube-apiserver pods in the 'kube-system' namespace
kubectl logs -n kube-system -l component=kube-apiserver --tail=100
Describe the kube-scheduler pods in the 'kube-system' namespace
kubectl describe pod -n kube-system -l component=kube-scheduler
Retrieve the last 100 lines of logs from kube-controller-manager pods in the 'kube-system' namespace
kubectl logs -n kube-system -l component=kube-controller-manager --tail=100
List master nodes using the node-rolekubernetesio/master label
kubectl get nodes -l node-role.kubernetes.io/master
List worker nodes by excluding the master label
kubectl get nodes -l '!node-role.kubernetes.io/master'
Show labels for the namespace 'staging'
kubectl get namespace staging --show-labels
Edit the namespace 'test'
kubectl edit namespace test
Patch the namespace 'dev' to add a label owner=dev-team
kubectl patch namespace dev -p '{"metadata":{"labels":{"owner":"dev-team"}}}'
Retrieve the full JSON schema for the pod resource
kubectl explain pod --recursive
Retrieve the full JSON schema for the service resource
kubectl explain service --recursive
List all installed kubectl plugins
kubectl plugin list
Apply a multi-document YAML file 'all-resourcesyaml'
kubectl apply -f all-resources.yaml
Delete multiple resources defined in the file 'delete-allyaml'
kubectl delete -f delete-all.yaml
Display a summary of cluster resource usage using 'kubectl top nodes'
kubectl top nodes
Display a summary of pod resource usage using 'kubectl top pods'
kubectl top pods
Roll back the daemonset 'log-agent' to its previous revision
kubectl rollout undo daemonset log-agent
Roll back the statefulset 'db' to revision 2
kubectl rollout undo statefulset db --to-revision=2
List all services with custom columns for name, type, and cluster IP
kubectl get svc -o custom-columns=NAME:.metadata.name,TYPE:.spec.type,CLUSTER-IP:.spec.clusterIP
List all persistent volumes with their capacity
kubectl get pv -o custom-columns=NAME:.metadata.name,CAPACITY:.spec.capacity.storage
Update the image of container 'app-container' in pod 'app-pod' to 'myimage:latest'
kubectl set image pod/app-pod app-container=myimage:latest
Debug pod 'debug-pod' by launching an ephemeral container with the busybox image
kubectl debug pod/debug-pod --image=busybox --target=debug-pod
Debug node 'node-1' by running an ephemeral container with the busybox image
kubectl debug node/node-1 -it --image=busybox
Create a certificate signing request using the configuration in 'csryaml'
kubectl create -f csr.yaml
Approve the certificate signing request 'my-csr'
kubectl certificate approve my-csr
Deny the certificate signing request 'old-csr'
kubectl certificate deny old-csr
List all certificate signing requests in the cluster
kubectl get csr
Filter kube-apiserver logs for audit entries
kubectl logs -n kube-system -l component=kube-apiserver | grep audit
Display the configuration of the kube-proxy ConfigMap in the 'kube-system' namespace
kubectl get configmap kube-proxy -n kube-system -o yaml
Apply changes to the kube-proxy configuration from the file 'kube-proxyyaml'
kubectl apply -f kube-proxy.yaml -n kube-system
List all endpoints with detailed addresses and ports
kubectl get endpoints -o wide
Watch for changes in pods in the 'default' namespace
kubectl get pods -n default --watch
Watch for changes in the node list
kubectl get nodes --watch
Create a new namespace 'integration-test' and label it with env=testing
kubectl create namespace integration-test && kubectl label namespace integration-test env=testing
Delete the namespace 'integration-test'
kubectl delete namespace integration-test
Set the default namespace of the current context to 'default'
kubectl config set-context --current --namespace=default
Unset the default namespace for the current context
kubectl config set-context --current --namespace=
Apply updates to deployment 'api-deploy' using server-side apply from 'apiyaml'
kubectl apply --server-side -f api.yaml
Perform a dry-run server-side apply on deployment 'api-deploy' from 'apiyaml'
kubectl apply --server-side --dry-run=server -f api.yaml
Wait for the rollout of deployment 'worker-deploy' to complete
kubectl rollout status deployment worker-deploy
Show the rollout history for replication controller 'rc-old'
kubectl rollout history rc rc-old
Display the rollout history for statefulset 'cache'
kubectl rollout history statefulset cache
Set the concurrency policy of cronjob 'cleanup' to Forbid new runs
kubectl patch cronjob cleanup -p '{"spec":{"concurrencyPolicy": "Forbid"}}'
Suspend the cronjob 'cleanup'
kubectl patch cronjob cleanup -p '{"spec": {"suspend": true}}'
Resume the cronjob 'cleanup'
kubectl patch cronjob cleanup -p '{"spec": {"suspend": false}}'
List all lease objects in the 'kube-node-lease' namespace
kubectl get lease -n kube-node-lease
Describe the lease 'node-lease' in the 'kube-node-lease' namespace
kubectl describe lease node-lease -n kube-node-lease
Fetch logs from the init container named 'init-container' in pod 'init-pod'
kubectl logs init-pod -c init-container
Execute an interactive shell in the init container of pod 'init-pod'
kubectl exec -it init-pod -c init-container -- /bin/sh
List all jobs with the label batch=true
kubectl get jobs -l batch=true
Delete the job 'cleanup-job' in the 'batch' namespace
kubectl delete job cleanup-job -n batch
List all pods with custom columns showing name and restart count
kubectl get pods -o custom-columns=NAME:.metadata.name,RESTARTS:.status.containerStatuses[*].restartCount
Watch changes for the replication controller 'rc-watch'
kubectl get rc rc-watch --watch
List all non-namespaced API resources
kubectl api-resources --namespaced=false
View the kubeconfig details for the current context
kubectl config view --minify
Add a new cluster 'new-cluster' to your kubeconfig with an insecure connection
kubectl config set-cluster new-cluster --server=https://new.cluster:6443 --insecure-skip-tls-verify=true
Add a new user 'new-user' to your kubeconfig with basic credentials
kubectl config set-credentials new-user --username=new-user --password=pass123
Create a new context 'new-context' using cluster 'new-cluster' and user 'new-user'
kubectl config set-context new-context --cluster=new-cluster --user=new-user
Switch the current context to 'new-context'
kubectl config use-context new-context
List all contexts in the kubeconfig
kubectl config get-contexts
Display the entire kubeconfig file in raw YAML format
kubectl config view --raw
Update deployment 'backend' to set its container 'backend' image pull policy to Always
kubectl patch deployment backend -p '{"spec":{"template":{"spec":{"containers":[{"name":"backend","imagePullPolicy":"Always"}]}}}}'
Retrieve logs from a previously terminated container in pod 'failure-pod'
kubectl logs failure-pod --previous
Run a pod named 'hello' using the busybox image that prints 'Hello, Kubernetes' and sleeps
kubectl run hello --image=busybox --restart=Never -- /bin/sh -c 'echo Hello, Kubernetes; sleep 3600'
Delete the pod 'hello' after testing
kubectl delete pod hello
Create a configmap named 'env-config' from the environment file 'appenv'
kubectl create configmap env-config --from-env-file=app.env
Mount the configmap 'env-config' into deployment 'app-deploy' at the path /etc/config
kubectl set volume deployment/app-deploy --add --name=config-volume --configmap-name=env-config --mount-path=/etc/config
Update the configmap 'env-config' from the file 'appenv' using a dry-run and apply
kubectl create configmap env-config --from-env-file=app.env --dry-run=client -o yaml | kubectl apply -f -
Force delete a pod named 'stuck-pod' without waiting for graceful termination
kubectl delete pod stuck-pod --grace-period=0 --force
Annotate deployment 'web-deploy' with the commit hash 'abc123'
kubectl annotate deployment web-deploy commit=abc123
Label the pod 'temp-pod' with the label test=true
kubectl label pod temp-pod test=true
Remove the 'test' label from pod 'temp-pod'
kubectl label pod temp-pod test-
Export all deployments in the 'default' namespace to a YAML file named 'deploymentsyaml'
kubectl get deployments -n default -o yaml > deployments.yaml
List all pods in namespace 'custom'
kubectl get pods -n custom
Get detailed information about deployment 'frontend' in JSON format
kubectl get deployment frontend -o json
Watch live updates for statefulsets in namespace 'default'
kubectl get statefulsets -n default --watch
Display all pods with the label 'env=staging'
kubectl get pods -l env=staging
Describe the service account 'default' in namespace 'kube-system'
kubectl describe serviceaccount default -n kube-system
Set image pull policy for deployment 'app' to Always using patch
kubectl patch deployment app -p '{"spec":{"template":{"spec":{"containers":[{"name":"app","imagePullPolicy":"Always"}]}}}}'
Roll back deployment 'app' to a previous revision
kubectl rollout undo deployment app
Get pods in namespace 'default' with their IP addresses
